fieldDefDTO Data Type

Represents a field definition in the system.

Namespace
(Default)
Properties
name data type type namespace min/max occurs description
blank_option boolean element 1/1 Should a blank option be selectable in the UI? Enable this option if you'd like users to have the option of leaving the field blank.
changeable boolean element 1/1 Can the field values ever change? For example, the incident create_date field cannot ever change so changeable will be false for that field.
chosen boolean element 1/1 Is the field a "chosen" field? This appears in the Co3 UI as "Advanced UI". It is valid only for select and multiselect fields. It's best to enable this option when there will be several values to choose from. This option allows the user to search the list for a certain value, and is more visually appealing for longer lists and multiselects."}
export_key string element 0/1 This value is used for export/import to uniquely represent this field
hide_notification boolean element 1/1 The field should be hidden from the list of fields allowed in notification trigger conditions. Generally this should be false for custom fields.
input_type inputType element 0/1 The input type for this field (e.g. "select", "multiselect", "text", etc.). For a list of valid input types, see constDTO (input_types property).
internal boolean element 1/1 Is this field an internal Co3 field? This value is read-only.
label_false string element 0/1 The label for a boolean false value. Default is "No" and is currently read-only.
label_null string element 0/1 The label for a boolean null value. Default is "Unknown" and is currently read-only.
label_true string element 0/1 The label for a boolean true value. Default is "Yes" and is currently read-only.
operation_perms (custom) element 0/1 The "permissions" for the individual condition methods.
operations methodName element 0/unbounded The set of valid condition operations for this field. These are the conditions that can appear in the notification or action triggers section. This value is read-only.
order int element 0/1 The order of this column in the table (1 = leftmost)
perms fieldDefPermsDTO element 0/1 The permissions the caller has on this field. This value is read-only. This value is set based on the permissions of the caller. See FieldDefPermsDTO.
placeholder string element 0/1 The placeholder to display in the edit field (not applicable for all input types).
read_only boolean element 1/1 True if this is a read-only field, false otherwise.
required fieldRequired element 0/1 The required status of the field. Valid values:
  • "always" - a value is always required, even when initially creating the object.
  • "close" - a value is required before the object (incident) can be closed. The Co3 UI will prompt the user on close if a value is not available.
  • null - a value is optional
rich_text boolean element 1/1  
tooltip string element 0/1 The tooltip to display next to the field (i.e. the popup text to display when the user hovers over the "i" icon).
type_id int element 1/1 The internal ID of the type. This field is read-only.
uuid string element 0/1 The UUID of this field. This value is read-only. The server sets this value when the field is initially created.
values fieldDefValueDTO element 0/unbounded The possible values for this field. This is only applicable for select and multiselect fields.
width int element 0/1 The width of this column
Properties inherited from partialFieldDefDTO
int element 0/1 The internal ID of this field. This value is read-only. The server sets this value when the field is initially created.
string element 0/1 The name of the field (e.g. 'name', 'incident_type_ids', etc.)
string element 0/1 The prefix to use when setting the field value in a DTO. For example, the prefix for the "data_source_ids" field is "pii". When setting the value in an incident, you must include "data_source_ids" in a sub-JSON object named "pii". For example: 
   {
     "id": 555,
     "name": "Test incident",
     ...
     "pii": {
       "data_source_ids": [1234, 1235],
       ...
     }
   }
string element 0/1 The text displayed right next to the field (e.g. "Name", "Incident Type", etc.).

Example

<fieldDefDTO>
  <type_id>...</type_id>
  <tooltip>...</tooltip>
  <placeholder>...</placeholder>
  <input_type>...</input_type>
  <required>...</required>
  <hide_notification>...</hide_notification>
  <chosen>...</chosen>
  <blank_option>...</blank_option>
  <internal>...</internal>
  <operations>...</operations>
  <values>
    <default>...</default>
    <enabled>...</enabled>
    <hidden>...</hidden>
    <properties>...</properties>
    <uuid>...</uuid>
    <value>...</value>
    <label>...</label>
  </values>
  <uuid>...</uuid>
  <perms>
    <delete>...</delete>
    <modify_name>...</modify_name>
    <modify_values>...</modify_values>
    <modify_blank>...</modify_blank>
    <modify_required>...</modify_required>
    <modify_operations>...</modify_operations>
    <modify_chosen>...</modify_chosen>
    <modify_default>...</modify_default>
    <modify_type>...</modify_type>
    <sort>...</sort>
    <show_in_manual_actions>...</show_in_manual_actions>
    <show_in_auto_actions>...</show_in_auto_actions>
    <show_in_notifications>...</show_in_notifications>
  </perms>
  <read_only>...</read_only>
  <operation_perms>...</operation_perms>
  <changeable>...</changeable>
  <label_false>...</label_false>
  <label_true>...</label_true>
  <label_null>...</label_null>
  <rich_text>...</rich_text>
  <export_key>...</export_key>
  <order>...</order>
  <width>...</width>
  <name>...</name>
  <text>...</text>
  <id>...</id>
  <prefix>...</prefix>
</fieldDefDTO>
